title: How to Cook Italian American Pasta Bolognese

steps.headline: Boil the noodles/pasta.
steps.description: Pour cold water in a medium-sized pot, turn on the stove at over high heat, and add one teaspoon of salt. Wait until it has come to a boil, then drop the pasta into the boiling water.

steps.headline: Reduce the temperature to medium and cook until the noodles are tender enough for your liking.
steps.description: Then, turn off the stove and then take the pot out to the sink, pour the pasta into a basket, and let it drain.

steps.headline: Prepare a large, deep skillet while the pasta cooks.
steps.description: Turn on the stove at medium heat, heat the pan and wait for the onions to brown, then add garlic. After the garlic has cooked, pour the ground beef into the pan, mix well until it browns evenly.

steps.headline: Pour wine into the pan: and continue to cook it over medium heat until the wine has reduced.
Reduce the heat to medium and add tomatoes and celery into the pan, mix well.
Add additional onions and carrots, continue to cook for about two minutes, then add black pepper, salt, a bay leaf, and patchouli or basil.
Reduce the heat and cook at low temperature for about 30 minutes to 1 1/2  hours, or until the meat is tender.
Divide the right amount of pasta on each plate.
steps.description: Reheat by steaming in the microwave for about 30 seconds.

text: Cooking Boil the noodles/pasta. Pour cold water in a medium-sized pot, turn on the stove at over high heat, and add one teaspoon of salt. Wait until it has come to a boil, then drop the pasta into the boiling water. Reduce the temperature to medium and cook until the noodles are tender enough for your liking. Then, turn off the stove and then take the pot out to the sink, pour the pasta into a basket, and let it drain. Prepare a large, deep skillet while the pasta cooks. Turn on the stove at medium heat, heat the pan and wait for the onions to brown, then add garlic. After the garlic has cooked, pour the ground beef into the pan, mix well until it browns evenly. Pour wine into the pan: and continue to cook it over medium heat until the wine has reduced.  Reduce the heat to medium and add tomatoes and celery into the pan, mix well.  Add additional onions and carrots, continue to cook for about two minutes, then add black pepper, salt, a bay leaf, and patchouli or basil.  Reduce the heat and cook at low temperature for about 30 minutes to 1 1/2  hours, or until the meat is tender.  Remove any bay leaves.  Serving Divide the right amount of pasta on each plate. Reheat by steaming in the microwave for about 30 seconds. Ladle a batch of beef sauce: poured on top, sprinkle with cheeses and bacon on its surface, sprinkle a little pepper, then decorate with basil leaves.  Finished.
